info.title: Payouts
info.description: Use the Payouts API to make payments to multiple PayPal or Venmo recipients. The Payouts API is a fast, convenient way to send commissions, rebates, rewards, and general disbursements. You can send up to 15,000 payments per call. If you integrated the Payouts API before September 1, 2017, you receive transaction reports through Mass Payments Reporting. Otherwise, view reports from your PayPal Business account. The Payouts API uses the ISO 8601 Internet date and time format.

post.description:
Creates a batch payout. In the JSON request body, pass a `sender_batch_header` and an `items` array. The `sender_batch_header` defines how to handle the payout. The `items` array defines the payout items.
You can make payouts to one or more recipients.
Notes:

  • PayPal does not process duplicate payouts. If you specify a sender_batch_id that was used in the last 30 days, the API rejects the request with an error message that shows the duplicate sender_batch_id and includes a HATEOAS link to the original payout with the same sender_batch_id.

    If you receive an HTTP 5nn status code, you can safely retry the request with the same sender_batch_id.

  • The Payouts API does not support build notation (BN) codes. In a future Payouts release, you can optionally provide BN codes in the PayPal-Partner-Attribution-Id request header.

    For information about the PayPal-Partner-Attribution-Id header, see HTTP request headers. To learn about or request a BN code, contact your partner manager or see PayPal Partner Program.

201.description: A successful request returns the HTTP 201 Created status code and a JSON response body that shows the ID for the payout and payout details. To show payout status, use the payout_batch_id value that appears in the response. If the initial scan that checks for syntax errors, missing or duplicated keywords, and more succeeds, the batch_status is PENDING. The initial scan checks for syntax errors and missing or duplicated keywords. The API does not immediately validate some payout item values, such as the receiver phone numbers.

get.description: Shows the latest status of a batch payout. Includes the transaction status and other data for individual payout items.

200.description: A successful request returns the HTTP `200 OK` status code and a JSON response body that shows batch payout details.

get.description: Shows details for a payout item, by ID. A payout_item_id helps you identify denied payments. If a payment is denied, you can use the payout_item_id to identify the payment even if it lacks a transaction_id.

200.description: A successful request returns the HTTP 200 OK status code and a JSON response body with a payout_item_details object, which contains data about a payout item including the transaction status.

post.description: Cancels an unclaimed payout item, by ID. If no one claims the unclaimed item within 30 days, the API automatically returns the funds to the sender. Use this call to cancel the unclaimed item before the automatic 30-day refund. You can cancel payout items with a transaction_status of UNCLAIMED.

200.description: A successful request returns the HTTP `200 OK` status code with a JSON response body that shows payout item details.

tags.name: payouts
tags.description: Use the `/payouts` resource to create a batch payout, update the status for a batch payout, show the status of a batch payout with the transaction status and other data for individual payout items, and request approval for a batch payout.

tags.name: payouts-item
tags.description: Use the `/payouts-item` resource to show payout item details and cancel an unclaimed payout item.

tags.name: payouts-statistics
tags.description: Use the `/payouts-statistics` resource to show statistics for a batch payout by date range.

tags.name: payouts-disbursement-notifications
tags.description: Use the `payouts/disbursement-notifications` resource for status updates from VENMO

scopes.https://uri.paypal.com/payments/payouts: Payout to a list of recipients.

paypal_request_id.name: PayPal-Request-Id
paypal_request_id.description: The server stores keys for 30 days.

payout_batch_id.name: payout_batch_id
payout_batch_id.description: The ID of the payout to update.

fields.name: fields
fields.description: Shows details for only the specified fields.

page.name: page
page.description: A non-zero integer representing the page of the results.

page_size.name: page_size
page_size.description: The maximum number of results to return at one time. Value is a non-negative, non-zero integer. If the user chooses pagination, the maximum page is `1000`.

total_required.name: total_required
total_required.description: Indicates whether to show the total items and total pages count in the response.

payout_item_id.name: payout_item_id
payout_item_id.description: The ID of the payout item to cancel.

error_details.title: Error Details
error_details.description: The error details. Required for client-side `4XX` errors.

field.description: The field that caused the error. If this field is in the body, set this value to the field's JSON pointer value. Required for client-side errors.

value.description: The value of the field that caused the error.

location.description: The location of the field that caused the error. Value is `body`, `path`, or `query`.

issue.description: The unique, fine-grained application-level error code.

description.description: The human-readable description for an issue. The description can change over the lifetime of an API, so clients must not depend on this value.

enum: Request is not well-formed, syntactically incorrect, or violates schema.

debug_id.description: The PayPal internal ID. Used for correlation purposes.

information_link.description: The information link, or URI, that shows detailed information about this error for the developer.

enum: Authentication failed due to missing authorization header, or invalid authentication credentials.

debug_id.description: The PayPal internal ID. Used for correlation purposes.

information_link.description: The information link, or URI, that shows detailed information about this error for the developer.

enum: Authorization failed due to insufficient permissions.

debug_id.description: The PayPal internal ID. Used for correlation purposes.

information_link.description: The information link, or URI, that shows detailed information about this error for the developer.

enum: The specified resource does not exist.

debug_id.description: The PayPal internal ID. Used for correlation purposes.

information_link.description: The information link, or URI, that shows detailed information about this error for the developer.

enum: The server has detected a conflict while processing this request.

debug_id.description: The PayPal internal ID. Used for correlation purposes.

information_link.description: The information link, or URI, that shows detailed information about this error for the developer.

enum: The server does not support the request payload's media type.

debug_id.description: The PayPal internal ID. Used for correlation purposes.

information_link.description: The information link, or URI, that shows detailed information about this error for the developer.

enum: The requested action could not be performed, semantically incorrect, or failed business validation.

debug_id.description: The PayPal internal ID. Used for correlation purposes.

information_link.description: The information link, or URI, that shows detailed information about this error for the developer.

information_link.description: The information link, or URI, that shows detailed information about this error for the developer.

debug_id.description: The PayPal internal ID. Used for correlation purposes.

information_link.description: The information link, or URI, that shows detailed information about this error for the developer.

sender_batch_header.title: Sender Batch Header
sender_batch_header.description: The sender-provided payout header for a payout request.

sender_batch_id.description:
A sender-specified ID number. Tracks the payout in an accounting system.
Note:

PayPal does not process duplicate payouts. If you specify a sender_batch_id that was used in the last 30 days, the API rejects the request with an error message that shows the duplicate sender_batch_id and includes a HATEOAS link to the original payout with the same sender_batch_id.

If you receive an HTTP 5nn status code, you can safely retry the request with the same sender_batch_id. The API completes a payment only once for a sender_batch_id that is used within 30 days.

recipient_type.description: The ID type that identifies the recipient of the payment. For example, EMAIL.

email_subject.description: The subject line for the email that PayPal sends when payment for a payout item completes. The subject line is the same for all recipients. Value is an alphanumeric string of up to 255 single-byte characters.

email_message.description: The email message that PayPal sends when the payout item completes. The message is the same for all recipients.

note.description: The payouts and item-level notes are concatenated in the email. The maximum combined length of the notes is 1000 characters.

currency.title: Currency
currency.description: The currency and amount for a financial transaction, such as a balance or payment due.

value.description:
The value, which might be:
  • An integer for currencies like `JPY` that are not typically fractional.
  • A decimal fraction for currencies like `TND` that are subdivided into thousandths.
For the required number of decimal places for a currency code, see [Currency codes - ISO 4217](https://www.iso.org/iso-4217-currency-codes.html).

phone.title: Phone
phone.description: The phone number in its canonical international [E.164 numbering plan format](https://www.itu.int/rec/T-REC-E.164/en).

country_code.description: The country calling code (CC), in its canonical international [E.164 numbering plan format](https://www.itu.int/rec/T-REC-E.164/en). The combined length of the CC and the national number must not be greater than 15 digits. The national number consists of a national destination code (NDC) and subscriber number (SN).

national_number.description: The national number, in its canonical international [E.164 numbering plan format](https://www.itu.int/rec/T-REC-E.164/en). The combined length of the country calling code (CC) and the national number must not be greater than 15 digits. The national number consists of a national destination code (NDC) and subscriber number (SN).

alternate_notification_method.title: Alternate Notification Method
alternate_notification_method.description: Captures additional notification modes to reach out to the receiver regarding this payment.

phone.description: The mobile phone number of the receiver.

language.description: The [language tag](https://tools.ietf.org/html/bcp47#section-2) for the language in which to localize the error-related strings, such as messages, issues, and suggested actions. The tag is made up of the [ISO 639-2 language code](https://www.loc.gov/standards/iso639-2/php/code_list.php), the optional [ISO-15924 script tag](https://www.unicode.org/iso15924/codelists.html), and the [ISO-3166 alpha-2 country code](/docs/integration/direct/rest/country-codes/).

social_feed_privacy.description: This attribute controls the privacy of a payout transaction in recipientâ€™s feed. PUBLIC, FRIENDS_ONLY & PRIVATE are the values that can be used. PUBLIC - The payment displays on the recipient's public Venmo feed. FRIENDS_ONLY - The payment displays only to the recipient's Venmo friends. PRIVATE - The payment displays only on the recipient's personal feed. Defaults to `PRIVATE` if left blank.

holler_url.description: Link to a Holler sticker. For Venmo recipients, the sticker displays with the payout message. The maximum URL length is 151.

logo_url.description: Link to a logo that displays as the sender's profile image in the recipient's Venmo feed. Used to add or update the business profile image. Max image size: 1024 x 1024 pixels. The image should be square and maximum URL length is 2000.

payout_item.title: Payout Item
payout_item.description: The sender-created payout to a recipient.

recipient_type.description:
The recipient type. Value is:

  • EMAIL. The unencrypted email. Value is a string of up to 127 single-byte characters.

  • PHONE. The unencrypted phone number.

    Note: The PayPal sandbox does not support the PHONE recipient type.

  • PAYPAL_ID. The encrypted PayPal account number.

  • USER_HANDLE. User handle (or) Username associated with Venmo account.


If the sender_batch_header includes the recipient_type attribute, payout items use the recipient_type of the sender_batch_header, unless a payout item has its own recipient_type attribute. If the sender_batch_header omits the recipient_type attribute, each payout item must include its own recipient_type value.

amount.description: The currency and amount to pay the receiver.

note.description: The sender-specified note for notifications. Supports up to 4000 ASCII characters and 1000 non-ASCII characters.

receiver.description: The receiver of the payment. Corresponds to the `recipient_type` value in the request. Max value of up to 127 single-byte characters.

sender_item_id.description: The sender-specified ID number. Tracks the payout in an accounting system.

alternate_notification_method.description: Captures additional notification modes to reach out to the receiver regarding this payment.

notification_language.description: The language in which to show the payout recipient's email message. Used only when the recipient does not have a PayPal account. If you omit the language or provide invalid language and the recipient does not have a PayPal account, the email message is sent in the language of the merchant's PayPal account.

application_context.description: Metadata for accepting additional information from merchants to Venmo.

sender_batch_header.description: The sender-provided payout header for a payout request.

items.description: An array of individual payout items.

recipient_enum.description: The ID type that identifies the payment receiver.

payout_sender_batch_header.title: Payout Sender Batch Header
payout_sender_batch_header.description: The sender-provided header for a payout request.

sender_batch_id.description:
The sender-specified ID number. Tracks the payout in an accounting system.
Note:

PayPal does not process duplicate payouts. If you specify a sender_batch_id that was used in the last 30 days, the API rejects the request with an error message that shows the duplicate sender_batch_id and includes a HATEOAS link to the original payout with the same sender_batch_id.

If you receive an HTTP 5nn status code, you can safely retry the request with the same sender_batch_id. The API completes a payment only once for a sender_batch_id that is used within 30 days.

email_subject.description: The subject line for the email that PayPal sends when payment for a payout item completes. The subject line is the same for all recipients. Value is an alphanumeric string with a maximum length of 255 single-byte characters.

email_message.description: The email message that PayPal sends when the payout item completes. The message is the same for all recipients.

payout_header.title: Payout Header
payout_header.description: The payout header that is returned in response to a payout header request. Shows details for an entire payout request.

payout_batch_id.description: The PayPal-generated ID for a payout.

batch_status.description: The PayPal-generated payout status. If the payout passes preliminary checks, the status is `PENDING`.

time_created.description: The date and time when processing for the payout began, in [Internet date and time format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).

sender_batch_header.description: The original payout header, as provided by the payment sender.

href.description: The complete target URL. To make the related call, combine the method with this [URI Template-formatted](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6570) link. For pre-processing, include the `$`, `(`, and `)` characters. The `href` is the key HATEOAS component that links a completed call with a subsequent call.

rel.description: The [link relation type](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5988#section-4), which serves as an ID for a link that unambiguously describes the semantics of the link. See [Link Relations](https://www.iana.org/assignments/link-relations/link-relations.xhtml).

method.description: The HTTP method required to make the related call.

payout_batch_header.title: Payout Batch Header
payout_batch_header.description: The payout header that is returned in response to a payout header request. Shows details for an entire payout request.

payout_batch_id.description: The PayPal-generated ID for a payout.

batch_status.description: The PayPal-generated payout status. If the payout passes preliminary checks, the status is `PENDING`.

time_created.description: The date and time when processing for the payout began, in [Internet date and time format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).

time_completed.description: The date and time when processing for the payout was completed, in [Internet date and time format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).

time_closed.description: The date and time when the payout was closed, in [Internet date and time format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6). A payout is considered closed when all items in a batch are processed and the available balance from the temporary hold is released.

sender_batch_header.description: The original payout header, as provided by the payment sender.

funding_source.description: The ID to differentiate a PayPal balance-funded transaction from a PayPal treasury-funded transaction.

amount.description: The currency and total amount requested for the payouts.

fees.description: The currency and amount of the total estimate for the applicable payouts fees. Initially, the fee is `0`. The fee is populated after the payout moves to the `PROCESSING` state.

transaction_enum.description:
The item transaction status.
Note: For POST/v1/payments/payouts-item/{payout_item_id}/cancel, the only possible transaction_status value is RETURNED.

prefix.description: The prefix, or title, to the party's name.

given_name.description: When the party is a person, the party's given, or first, name.

surname.description: When the party is a person, the party's surname or family name. Also known as the last name. Required when the party is a person. Use also to store multiple surnames including the matronymic, or mother's, surname.

middle_name.description: When the party is a person, the party's middle name. Use also to store multiple middle names including the patronymic, or father's, middle name.

suffix.description: The suffix for the party's name.

alternate_full_name.description: DEPRECATED. The party's alternate name. Can be a business name, nickname, or any other name that cannot be split into first, last name. Required when the party is a business.

full_name.description: When the party is a person, the party's full name.

recipient_wallet_enum.description: The wallet where the recipient receives the payout. Payouts to Venmo recipients require a 'note' string and a US mobile phone number.

payout_item_detail.title: Payout Item Detail
payout_item_detail.description: The details for a sender-created payout to a single recipient.

amount.description: The currency and amount of payout item. Might be an integer for currencies like `JPY` that are not typically fractional or a decimal fraction for currencies like `TND` that are subdivided into thousandths. For the required number of decimal places for a currency code, see [Currency codes - ISO 4217](https://www.iso.org/iso-4217-currency-codes.html).

note.description: The sender-specified note for notifications. Supports up to 4000 ASCII characters and 1000 non-ASCII characters.

receiver.description: The receiver of the payment. Corresponds to the `recipient_type` value in the request.

sender_item_id.description: A sender-specified ID number. Tracks the payout in an accounting system.

recipient_name.description: The name of the recipient where money is credited. For `UNCLAIMED` payments, the recipient name is populated after the payment is claimed.

from_amount.description: The amount that is converted from.

to_amount.description: The amount that is converted to.

exchange_rate.description: The exchange rate that is applied for this payout.

name.description: The human-readable, unique name of the error.

message.description: The message that describes the error.

debug_id.description: The PayPal internal ID. Used for correlation purposes.

information_link.description: The information link, or URI, that shows detailed information about this error for the developer.

details.description: An array of additional details about the error.

payout_batch_items.title: Payout Item
payout_batch_items.description: The payout item status and other details.

payout_item_id.description: The ID for the payout item. Viewable when you show details for a payout.

transaction_id.description: The PayPal-generated ID for the transaction.

activity_id.description: The unique PayPal-generated common ID created to link sender side and receiver side transaction. Used for tracking.

payout_batch_id.description: The PayPal-generated ID for the payout.

payout_item.description: The sender-provided information for the payout item.

currency_conversion.description: The currency conversion applicable for this payout item.

time_processed.description: The date and time when this item was last processed, in [Internet date and time format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).

total_items.description: The total number of items in the full result list.

batch_header.description: A payout header. Includes the generated payout status.

payout_item-2.title: Payout Item
payout_item-2.description: The payout item status and other details. A payout_item_id helps you identify denied payments. If a payment is denied, you can use the payout_item_id to identify the payment even if it lacks a transaction_id.

payout_item_id.description: The ID for the payout item. Visible when you show details for a payout.

transaction_id.description: The PayPal-generated ID for the transaction.

activity_id.description: The unique PayPal-generated common ID that links the sender- and receiver-side transactions. Used for tracking.

payout_item_fee.description: The estimate for the payout fee. Initially, the fee is `0`. The fee is populated after the item moves to the `PENDING` state

payout_batch_id.description: The PayPal-generated ID for the payout batch.

sender_batch_id.description: A sender-specified ID. Tracks the payout in an accounting system. Should be unique within 30 days.

payout_item.description: The sender-provided information for the payout item.

currency_conversion.description: The currency conversion applicable for this payout item.

time_processed.description: The date and time when this item was last processed, in [Internet date and time format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).

sender_batch_header.email_message: You have received a payout! Thanks for using our service!
